alert.note: Alert for North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 8:06PM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...A FEW STRONG THUNDERSTORMS POSSIBLE OVER THE BOUNDARY WATERS BEFORE 10 PM... A few strong thunderstorms are possible over the Boundary Waters Canoe Area Wilderness before 10 PM. The strongest storms will be capable of erratic and gusty winds of 30 to 50 mph, hail up to the size of pennies, occasional cloud-to-ground lightning. There is a small risk of locally heavy rainfall overnight, which may lead to localized flooding of creeks, streams, and low-lying areas. Campers should take extra precautions in order to secure campsites and make a plan in case of severe weather. Check campsites for possible hazards, including standing dead trees or limbs, as well as low spots where water can pool. Move tents away from creeks and rivers to prepare for flash flooding. Be ready to protect yourself from large hail using sleeping bags or other padded items. Monitor NOAA Weather Radio for updates and possible warnings.

area.areaDesc: North St. Louis; Northern Cook, Northern Lake
